info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Caldwell, southeastern Avery and northwestern Burke Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Newland, or near Crossnore. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crossnore, Linville Falls, Grandfather Mountain State Park, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, Edgemont, Pineola, Linville, Jonas Ridge and Globe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
